meanings.sent1: She premonished him about the storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: The teacher premonishes the students to study for the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The cat premonished the birds to stay away from its nest.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor's tales premonish of the dangers lurking in the deep sea.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds premonishing a heavy rain made everyone rush indoors.

meanings.sent1: The premonishing letter urged them to evacuate before the hurricane.
meanings.sent2: His premonishing tone indicated the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The premonishing look on her face made him rethink his decision.
meanings.sent4: The premonishing signs of an approaching storm prompted them to take shelter.
meanings.sent5: The premonishing dream warned her of the danger ahead.
